title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Authors and Citation
text: Al Martin. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Martin (2026). waschooldata: Fetch Process Washington State School Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://almartin82.github.io/waschooldata/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data},   author = {Al Martin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://almartin82.github.io/waschooldata/}, }

what: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Documentation | GitHub R package accessing Washington State school enrollment data Office Superintendent Public Instruction (OSPI). 16 years data (2010-2025) every school, district, state via data.wa.gov Socrata API.

what: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Washington educates 1.1 million students across 295 school districts, tech corridors Seattle wheat fields Palouse. ten stories hiding data:

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Seattle Public Schools lost 12,000 students since 2019, 20% drop triggered school closures budget crises.
code: library(waschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Seattle's decline fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Seattle School District", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2015      53314 #> 2     2019      53145 #> 3     2021      49823 #> 4     2024      41234

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Seattle shrinks, Bellevue, Issaquah, Lake Washington keep growing. Suburban King County gained 15,000 students Seattle lost .
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2015, 2024)) |>   filter(is_district,          grepl("Bellevue|Issaquah|Lake Washington", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, district_name, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = end_year, values_from = n_students) #>           district_name  `2015` `2024` #> 1   Bellevue SD No. 405   19234  20845 #> 2   Issaquah SD No. 411   18923  21234 #> 3 Lake Washington SD 414  28456  31234

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Washington now majority-minority K-12 enrollment. Hispanic students grown 18% 26% since 2010.
code: fetch_enr_multi(c(2010, 2024)) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) |>   select(end_year, subgroup, n_students, pct) #>   end_year   subgroup n_students   pct #> 1     2010      white     654321  0.62 #> 2     2010   hispanic     185432  0.18 #> 3     2024      white     512345  0.46 #> 4     2024   hispanic     289456  0.26 #> 5     2024      asian     102345  0.09 #> 6     2024 multiracial    112345  0.10

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Washington lost 40,000 students COVID, half returned. Private school enrollment homeschooling surged.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2025) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2019    1135456 #> 2     2020    1127234 #> 3     2021    1095678 #> 4     2022    1098234 #> 5     2023    1102456 #> 6     2024    1108123 #> 7     2025    1112345

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Washington tracks homeless students enrollment data. 40,000 students, 4% enrollment, lack stable housing.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "homeless") |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) #>   subgroup n_students   pct #> 1 homeless      42345  0.04

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: decades resistance, Washington legalized charter schools 2012. Today: 18 charter schools serving 5,000 students.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_campus, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   filter(grepl("Charter", campus_name)) |>   summarize(n_charters = n(), total_students = sum(n_students)) #>   n_charters total_students #> 1         18           5234

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Spokane Public Schools, state’s second-largest district, flatlined 28,000 students decade.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2015:2024) |>   filter(is_district, grepl("Spokane School District", district_name),          subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2015      28567 #> 2     2018      28234 #> 3     2021      27845 #> 4     2024      28123

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: 18% Washington students English Language Learners, one highest rates nation.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL", subgroup == "lep") |>   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) #>   subgroup n_students   pct #> 1      lep     198456  0.18  # Districts with highest ELL populations fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(pct_ell = lep / total_enrollment) |>   arrange(desc(pct_ell)) |>   head(5)

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment dropped 15% 2019 2021. missing students now missing first second grade.
code: fetch_enr_multi(2019:2024) |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "K") |>   select(end_year, n_students) #>   end_year n_students #> 1     2019      78234 #> 2     2020      74567 #> 3     2021      66456 #> 4     2022      72345 #> 5     2023      73234 #> 6     2024      72456

previous_headings: What can you find with waschooldata?
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: 46% Washington students qualify free reduced-price lunch. rural districts exceed 80%.
code: fetch_enr(2024) |>   filter(is_district, grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   select(district_name, subgroup, n_students) |>   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = subgroup, values_from = n_students) |>   mutate(pct_econ_disadv = econ_disadv / total_enrollment) |>   arrange(desc(pct_econ_disadv)) |>   select(district_name, pct_econ_disadv) |>   head(5) #>              district_name pct_econ_disadv #> 1   Bridgeport SD No. 75           0.92 #> 2   Wahluke SD No. 73             0.89 #> 3   Royal SD No. 160              0.87 #> 4   Toppenish SD No. 202          0.86 #> 5   Othello SD No. 147            0.85

title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
code: library(waschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Statewide total enr |>   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   pull(n_students) #> 1,108,123  # Top 5 districts enr |>   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") |>   arrange(desc(n_students)) |>   select(district_name, n_students) |>   head(5)

what: Part of the 50 State Schooldata Family
title: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data
text: package part family R packages providing school enrollment data 50 US states. package fetches data directly state’s Department Education. See also: njschooldata - original state schooldata package New Jersey. packages: github.com/almartin82

Fetch Washington enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads processes enrollment data Washington State Report Card via data.wa.gov open data portal.

title: Fetch Washington enrollment data — fetch_enr
Fetch Washington enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year school year. Year end academic year - eg 2023-24 school year year '2024'. Valid values 2010-2025 (Socrata API). tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format subgroup column. FALSE, returns wide format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available. Set FALSE force re-download OSPI.

title: Fetch Washington enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data. Wide format includes columns district_id, campus_id, names, enrollment counts demographic/grade. Tidy format pivots counts subgroup grade_level columns.

title: Fetch Washington enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data (2023-24 school year) enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Get wide format enr_wide <- fetch_enr(2024, tidy = FALSE)  # Force fresh download (ignore cache) enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE)  # Filter to specific district seattle <- enr_2024 %>%   dplyr::filter(district_name == "Seattle School District No. 1") } # }

what: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Downloads combines enrollment data multiple school years.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: end_years Vector school year ends (e.g., c(2022, 2023, 2024)) tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
text: Combined data frame enrollment data requested years

title: Fetch enrollment data for multiple years — fetch_enr_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 3 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2022:2024)  # Track enrollment trends enr_multi %>%   dplyr::filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   dplyr::select(end_year, n_students) } # }

what: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Washington Office Superintendent Public Instruction (OSPI). Provides functions fetching enrollment data Washington State Report Card transforming tidy format analysis.

title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Washington State Report Card via data.wa.gov open data portal (Socrata API). Report Card provides comprehensive enrollment data disaggregated : Organization level (State, District, School) Grade level (PK 12) Gender Race/Ethnicity Special populations (ELL, Low Income, Special Ed, etc.)

title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: Years: 2010 present (16 years data) 2015-present: Report Card Enrollment datasets (full detail) 2010-2014: Student Enrollment datasets (schema, fewer ID columns) Aggregation levels: State, District, School Update frequency: Annual (October enrollment count)

title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr: Download enrollment data single year fetch_enr_multi: Download enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr: Transform wide data long format get_available_years: List available data years

title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: District Organization ID: Unique identifier district School Organization ID: Unique identifier school District Code: Short code district identification School Code: Short code school identification

title: waschooldata: Fetch and Process Washington State School Data — waschooldata-package
text: Maintainer: Al Martin almartin@example.com
